paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 N372 H i.a.1342A>C variant and its role in platinum resistance in ovarian cancer, providing functional data and some penetrance information.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: This study aimed to further investigate the mechanism of BRCA2 N372 H mutation in the development of platinum resistance in ovarian cancer.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 N372 H i.a.1342A>C variant was synthesized and shown to increase BRCA2 protein expression and RAD51 binding, leading to increased cell viability and resistance to cisplatin.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was specifically found in platinum-resistant patients.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests a potential mechanism for platinum resistance in ovarian cancer linked to this variant.
key_quotes: BRCA2 N372 H i.a.1342A>C heterozygous variation presented in platinum-resistant patients.
Over expression of mRNA and protein of BRCA2 was detected in the cells with BRCA2 N372 H i.a.1342A>C mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in BRCA2.
